overview.roleDetails: Architecture leadership, MVP introduction, Product List rewrite, Room database, Berlin business trip

companies.name: Lesara
companies.description: Berlin-based fast-fashion e-commerce startup, Europe's fastest-growing tech company. Raised €85M, reached 2M+ app downloads.

description.short: Native Android app for Europe's fastest-growing fashion startup (€85M funded, 2M+ downloads).
description.full: Lesara was a Berlin-based fast-fashion e-commerce company that pioneered 'agile retail' — getting products from trend identification to market in just 10 days. The company raised €85 million, expanded to 24 European markets, and the mobile apps reached 2M+ downloads with 4.5-star ratings. I joined as Senior Android Developer to fix a codebase with no architecture where 'a simple change could take days of debugging'. I initiated and documented a 4-stage architecture migration strategy (MVP → Clean Architecture → Modules → Kotlin), led the complete Product List rewrite with Sorting/Filtering, introduced Room database for offline caching, and presented Material Design guidelines during Berlin business trip.

howItWorked.title: Trend Detection
howItWorked.description: Lesara analyzed Google, social media, and blogs to identify emerging fashion trends

howItWorked.title: Fast Production
howItWorked.description: Direct work with Chinese manufacturers, products to market in 10 days

howItWorked.title: Mobile Shopping
howItWorked.description: Native Android app with product catalog, wishlist, cart, and checkout

howItWorked.title: European Delivery
howItWorked.description: Own warehouses in Europe and China for fast delivery across 24 markets

challenge.context: The Android codebase had no architecture - 'a simple change could take days of debugging for Android team and one hour for iOS team'. There was problematic custom navigation implementation that was 'extremely hard to support', and iOS/Web design patterns forced onto Android.
challenge.response: Initiated architecture discussions, created comprehensive documentation with migration strategy, led team adoption through presentations and architecture meetings. Also worked extensively with Design team to explain Android-specific constraints.
details: No architecture in existing codebase - days of debugging for simple changes
Custom navigation implementation 'extremely hard to support'
iOS/Web elements forced onto Android - 'looks like mobile website, not Android app'
Created 4-stage migration strategy documentation
Led architecture meetings and presentations
Collaborated with Design team on Android-specific constraints

achievements.title: Architecture Migration Strategy
achievements.problem: Codebase had no architecture causing days of debugging for simple changes. Team needed a clear path forward.
achievements.solution: Created comprehensive 4-stage migration strategy with detailed documentation covering SOLID principles, Clean Architecture, MVP, coding standards.
details: Stage 1: Re-structure code by features into com.lesara.app.feature package
Stage 2: Split application into modules matching package structure
Stage 3: Instant App support with unit and UI test coverage
Stage 4: Kotlin migration
Documented naming conventions: Item (UI), Entity (Domain), Model (Data)
Created RxJava coding standards (error handling, disposal, scheduling)
Led team discussions and got buy-in for migration

impact.text: Established architecture standards for the team

achievements.title: Product List Complete Rewrite (LAA-1175)
achievements.problem: Product list screens had loading issues and needed Sorting/Filtering features for competitive parity.
achievements.solution: Complete rewrite of Product List using new architecture with full Sorting and Filtering support across 10+ API endpoints.
details: ~2 months of development (October-November 2017)
Added Sorting support to 10+ API endpoints (Category, Event, Search, AlsoBought, Related, Recommended, Recent, TrendProducts, TopDeal, Emarsys, Preloaded)
Built custom Filtering dialog with expand/collapse, multi-select
Sub-categories implementation on ProductList
Christmas Shop integration
Analytics updates for all new features
Applied new MVP architecture pattern

impact.text: Major feature delivery with architectural improvements

achievements.title: Room Database & Offline Caching
achievements.problem: Wishlist and Cart had no offline support, and backend API had numerous bugs causing poor UX.
achievements.solution: Introduced Room database to the project and built offline-first caching strategy for Wishlist and Cart.
details: First Room database implementation in the project
Wishlist caching with sync strategy (LAA-1606)
Cart caching with Repository pattern (LAA-1607)
Built workarounds for numerous backend API bugs
Created Swagger API documentation examples for backend team
QA training sessions on using Charles proxy for API testing

achievements.title: Berlin Business Trip & Presentation
achievements.problem: Design team created iOS/Web-centric designs that were costly to implement on Android.
achievements.solution: Traveled to Berlin office (Dec 10-17, 2017), presented Material Design guidelines, collaborated with Design team.
details: Week-long business trip to Lesara Berlin headquarters
Presented Material Design guidelines and Android constraints
Topics: Material metaphor, colors, shadows, toolbar, navigation
Introduced Framer and Flutter as prototyping tools
Improved collaboration between Android and Design teams
Attended company Christmas party

achievements.title: Navigation System Improvements
achievements.problem: Custom navigation implementation was 'extremely hard to support' and caused numerous bugs.
achievements.solution: Multiple fixes and refactoring attempts to improve navigation stability while migrating incrementally.
details: Toolbar and Bottom Navigation Bar behavior fixes
View state save/restore implementation (LAA-1489)
Fixed navigation after checkout flow
BottomNavigationBarHelper rollback due to instability
Documented navigation issues and migration strategy

achievements.title: CI/CD & Release Process
achievements.problem: Manual builds and unclear release process slowed down development.
achievements.solution: Set up Bitrise CI/CD, nightly builds, and release automation.
details: Bitrise CI/CD configuration
Nightly builds setup with auto-increment build numbers
Crashlytics Beta distribution (Nightly vs Release Candidate)
Added Release Notes automation
Engineering/Debug menu for QA support

achievements.title: Codebase Cleanup
achievements.problem: Codebase contained over-engineered code and unused legacy code.
achievements.solution: Major cleanup removing thousands of lines of dead code.
details: Removed 4005+ lines of unused code in single cleanup session
Cleaned up unused layouts and images
Refactored PDP (Product Detail Page)
Moved DebugMenu to Debug-only build flavor

structure.notes: Me as Senior + mix of senior/middle developers
Testing, trained on Charles proxy usage

team.collaboration: Daily standups, bi-weekly grooming/planning, sprint demos, API meetings

learnings.title: Personal Learnings (from 3-month review)
items: Time estimation and importance of showing progress
Weak points in Android Animation and custom views
Feature branches for long-term tasks improve visibility
improvements: Single source of truth for requirements and documentation
Give percentage of sprint time for technical debt
Use story points for less personal estimation

events.event: Joined project as Senior Android Developer
Berlin business trip - Material Design presentation

lifecycle.discontinuationReason: Lesara filed for insolvency in November 2018 due to costly logistics expansion (€40-45M distribution center), operational problems causing delivery delays, unprofitability despite growth, and a last-minute investor withdrawal.

seo.title: Lesara - Senior Android Developer | Denys Honcharenko
seo.description: 8-month engagement at Lesara - Europe's fastest-growing fashion startup (€85M funded, 2M+ downloads). Created 4-stage architecture migration strategy, rewrote Product List with Sorting/Filtering, introduced Room database, presented Material Design during Berlin business trip.
